/home/mgh/LanlGeoMag/libLanlGeoMag/dqagi.f

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 *DECK DQAGI
00002       SUBROUTINE DQAGI (F, BOUND, INF, EPSABS, EPSREL, RESULT, ABSERR,
00003      +   NEVAL, IER, LIMIT, LENW, LAST, IWORK, WORK)
00004 C***BEGIN PROLOGUE  DQAGI
00005 C***PURPOSE  The routine calculates an approximation result to a given
00006 C            INTEGRAL   I = Integral of F over (BOUND,+INFINITY)
00007 C            OR I = Integral of F over (-INFINITY,BOUND)
00008 C            OR I = Integral of F over (-INFINITY,+INFINITY)
00009 C            Hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
00010 C            ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I)).
00011 C***LIBRARY   SLATEC (QUADPACK)
00012 C***CATEGORY  H2A3A1, H2A4A1
00013 C***TYPE      DOUBLE PRECISION (QAGI-S, DQAGI-D)
00014 C***KEYWORDS  AUTOMATIC INTEGRATOR, EXTRAPOLATION, GENERAL-PURPOSE,
00015 C             GLOBALLY ADAPTIVE, INFINITE INTERVALS, QUADPACK,
00016 C             QUADRATURE, TRANSFORMATION
00017 C***AUTHOR  Piessens, Robert
00018 C             Applied Mathematics and Programming Division
00019 C             K. U. Leuven
00020 C           de Doncker, Elise
00021 C             Applied Mathematics and Programming Division
00022 C             K. U. Leuven
00023 C***DESCRIPTION
00024 C
00025 C        Integration over infinite intervals
00026 C        Standard fortran subroutine
00027 C
00028 C        PARAMETERS
00029 C         ON ENTRY
00030 C            F      - Double precision
00031 C                     Function subprogram defining the integrand
00032 C                     function F(X). The actual name for F needs to be
00033 C                     declared E X T E R N A L in the driver program.
00034 C
00035 C            BOUND  - Double precision
00036 C                     Finite bound of integration range
00037 C                     (has no meaning if interval is doubly-infinite)
00038 C
00039 C            INF    - Integer
00040 C                     indicating the kind of integration range involved
00041 C                     INF = 1 corresponds to  (BOUND,+INFINITY),
00042 C                     INF = -1            to  (-INFINITY,BOUND),
00043 C                     INF = 2             to (-INFINITY,+INFINITY).
00044 C
00045 C            EPSABS - Double precision
00046 C                     Absolute accuracy requested
00047 C            EPSREL - Double precision
00048 C                     Relative accuracy requested
00049 C                     If  EPSABS.LE.0
00050 C                     and EPSREL.LT.MAX(50*REL.MACH.ACC.,0.5D-28),
00051 C                     the routine will end with IER = 6.
00052 C
00053 C
00054 C         ON RETURN
00055 C            RESULT - Double precision
00056 C                     Approximation to the integral
00057 C
00058 C            ABSERR - Double precision
00059 C                     Estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
00060 C                     which should equal or exceed ABS(I-RESULT)
00061 C
00062 C            NEVAL  - Integer
00063 C                     Number of integrand evaluations
00064 C
00065 C            IER    - Integer
00066 C                     IER = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
00067 C                             routine. It is assumed that the requested
00068 C                             accuracy has been achieved.
00069 C                   - IER.GT.0 abnormal termination of the routine. The
00070 C                             estimates for result and error are less
00071 C                             reliable. It is assumed that the requested
00072 C                             accuracy has not been achieved.
00073 C            ERROR MESSAGES
00074 C                     IER = 1 Maximum number of subdivisions allowed
00075 C                             has been achieved. One can allow more
00076 C                             subdivisions by increasing the value of
00077 C                             LIMIT (and taking the according dimension
00078 C                             adjustments into account). However, if
00079 C                             this yields no improvement it is advised
00080 C                             to analyze the integrand in order to
00081 C                             determine the integration difficulties. If
00082 C                             the position of a local difficulty can be
00083 C                             determined (e.g. SINGULARITY,
00084 C                             DISCONTINUITY within the interval) one
00085 C                             will probably gain from splitting up the
00086 C                             interval at this point and calling the
00087 C                             integrator on the subranges. If possible,
00088 C                             an appropriate special-purpose integrator
00089 C                             should be used, which is designed for
00090 C                             handling the type of difficulty involved.
00091 C                         = 2 The occurrence of roundoff error is
00092 C                             detected, which prevents the requested
00093 C                             tolerance from being achieved.
00094 C                             The error may be under-estimated.
00095 C                         = 3 Extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
00096 C                             at some points of the integration
00097 C                             interval.
00098 C                         = 4 The algorithm does not converge.
00099 C                             Roundoff error is detected in the
00100 C                             extrapolation table.
00101 C                             It is assumed that the requested tolerance
00102 C                             cannot be achieved, and that the returned
00103 C                             RESULT is the best which can be obtained.
00104 C                         = 5 The integral is probably divergent, or
00105 C                             slowly convergent. It must be noted that
00106 C                             divergence can occur with any other value
00107 C                             of IER.
00108 C                         = 6 The input is invalid, because
00109 C                             (EPSABS.LE.0 and
00110 C                              EPSREL.LT.MAX(50*REL.MACH.ACC.,0.5D-28))
00111 C                              or LIMIT.LT.1 or LENIW.LT.LIMIT*4.
00112 C                             RESULT, ABSERR, NEVAL, LAST are set to
00113 C                             zero.  Except when LIMIT or LENIW is
00114 C                             invalid, IWORK(1), WORK(LIMIT*2+1) and
00115 C                             WORK(LIMIT*3+1) are set to ZERO, WORK(1)
00116 C                             is set to A and WORK(LIMIT+1) to B.
00117 C
00118 C         DIMENSIONING PARAMETERS
00119 C            LIMIT - Integer
00120 C                    Dimensioning parameter for IWORK
00121 C                    LIMIT determines the maximum number of subintervals
00122 C                    in the partition of the given integration interval
00123 C                    (A,B), LIMIT.GE.1.
00124 C                    If LIMIT.LT.1, the routine will end with IER = 6.
00125 C
00126 C            LENW  - Integer
00127 C                    Dimensioning parameter for WORK
00128 C                    LENW must be at least LIMIT*4.
00129 C                    If LENW.LT.LIMIT*4, the routine will end
00130 C                    with IER = 6.
00131 C
00132 C            LAST  - Integer
00133 C                    On return, LAST equals the number of subintervals
00134 C                    produced in the subdivision process, which
00135 C                    determines the number of significant elements
00136 C                    actually in the WORK ARRAYS.
00137 C
00138 C         WORK ARRAYS
00139 C            IWORK - Integer
00140 C                    Vector of dimension at least LIMIT, the first
00141 C                    K elements of which contain pointers
00142 C                    to the error estimates over the subintervals,
00143 C                    such that WORK(LIMIT*3+IWORK(1)),... ,
00144 C                    WORK(LIMIT*3+IWORK(K)) form a decreasing
00145 C                    sequence, with K = LAST if LAST.LE.(LIMIT/2+2), and
00146 C                    K = LIMIT+1-LAST otherwise
00147 C
00148 C            WORK  - Double precision
00149 C                    Vector of dimension at least LENW
00150 C                    on return
00151 C                    WORK(1), ..., WORK(LAST) contain the left
00152 C                     end points of the subintervals in the
00153 C                     partition of (A,B),
00154 C                    WORK(LIMIT+1), ..., WORK(LIMIT+LAST) Contain
00155 C                     the right end points,
00156 C                    WORK(LIMIT*2+1), ...,WORK(LIMIT*2+LAST) contain the
00157 C                     integral approximations over the subintervals,
00158 C                    WORK(LIMIT*3+1), ..., WORK(LIMIT*3)
00159 C                     contain the error estimates.
00160 C
00161 C***REFERENCES  (NONE)
00162 C***ROUTINES CALLED  DQAGIE, XERMSG
00163 C***REVISION HISTORY  (YYMMDD)
00164 C   800101  DATE WRITTEN
00165 C   890831  Modified array declarations.  (WRB)
00166 C   890831  REVISION DATE from Version 3.2
00167 C   891214  Prologue converted to Version 4.0 format.  (BAB)
00168 C   900315  CALLs to XERROR changed to CALLs to XERMSG.  (THJ)
00169 C***END PROLOGUE  DQAGI
00170 C
00171       DOUBLE PRECISION ABSERR,BOUND,EPSABS,EPSREL,F,RESULT,WORK
00172       INTEGER IER,INF,IWORK,LAST,LENW,LIMIT,LVL,L1,L2,L3,NEVAL
00173 C
00174       DIMENSION IWORK(*),WORK(*)
00175 C
00176       EXTERNAL F
00177 C
00178 C         CHECK VALIDITY OF LIMIT AND LENW.
00179 C
00180 C***FIRST EXECUTABLE STATEMENT  DQAGI
00181       IER = 6
00182       NEVAL = 0
00183       LAST = 0
00184       RESULT = 0.0D+00
00185       ABSERR = 0.0D+00
00186       IF(LIMIT.LT.1.OR.LENW.LT.LIMIT*4) GO TO 10
00187 C
00188 C         PREPARE CALL FOR DQAGIE.
00189 C
00190       L1 = LIMIT+1
00191       L2 = LIMIT+L1
00192       L3 = LIMIT+L2
00193 C
00194       CALL DQAGIE(F,BOUND,INF,EPSABS,EPSREL,LIMIT,RESULT,ABSERR,
00195      1  NEVAL,IER,WORK(1),WORK(L1),WORK(L2),WORK(L3),IWORK,LAST)
00196 C
00197 C         CALL ERROR HANDLER IF NECESSARY.
00198 C
00199        LVL = 0
00200 10    IF(IER.EQ.6) LVL = 1
00201       IF (IER .NE. 0) CALL XERMSG ('SLATEC', 'DQAGI',
00202      +   'ABNORMAL RETURN', IER, LVL)
00203       RETURN
00204       END
00205
